item.title: 1. Write in front
item.description: Death is often seen as obscure and horrific, and various perceptions have arisen around it, both scientific and superstitious. Forensic pathology, the oldest and most important branch of the forensic profession with its own aura of mystery, has been given more mystery because it focuses on the study of death and corpses. I first learned about the profession of “forensic medicine”, in fact, through a film and television drama. At that time, I was still in junior high school, and every night at dinner time, the TV would play a domestic criminal investigation drama, the specific name of the drama now can not remember, only remember that there are a lot of such as “extract evidence back to the laboratory to check” “decent scientific analysis” and such unexplained scenes, the main object of examination is the bones, fingerprints, blood, etc.

item.title: 2. Forensic career of the 'first' scene
item.description: But all the things in this world, there is a first time. Some first time is nervous and excited, some first time is surprised and happy, some first time is sad and hard to suppress. In my case, my first contact with forensic work, but with the above-mentioned common feelings are not quite the same. My first real exposure to forensic work was in the summer after my freshman year. At that time, I contacted the director of forensic medicine of the Public Security Bureau, who would assign us to internship units, through my senior, and asked him to arrange a unit for me to experience forensic work first.

item.title: 3. What happens after a high fall
item.description: In the above scene, the deceased died by falling from a height, which is commonly known as “jumping”. Injuries caused by collision between the human body and the ground or certain objects during the fall are called fall injuries. The form and degree of injury are influenced by the height of the fall, the weight, the presence or absence of obstructions during the fall, the landing method, the landing area, the condition of the ground, and many other factors.

item.title: 4. Floating body in the river: how does the forensic pathologist determine the time of death of the deceased?
item.description: Those with distinctive features and multiple eyewitnesses of the high fall is easier to determine the nature of death, defined as an accident or suicide is a relatively simple matter, after the investigation there is no obvious doubt also generally do not need to be dissected; witnesses are sufficient, the family of the deceased usually will not have any questions. If the body has the kind of plausible damage, the family will see the catch, the forensic work is also more complex.

item.title: 7. How did the self-hanging lead to death?
item.description: In the above case, the deceased died by hanging himself in this way. Death by hanging is caused by using all or part of one’s own weight to compress a rope or other similar object around the neck. The majority of hangings are suicides, or self-hangings, commonly known as “hanging” and “hanging”. As a “star” death that often appears in various TV dramas, I believe we are not unfamiliar with hanging, so how exactly does hanging lead to death?

item.title: 8. Hands struggling to survive
item.description: The actual work of the doctor, the face of the scene of self-hanging is too much. However, the majority of such scenes, by the time the forensic pathologist arrives, have been dead for some time, and the forensic pathologist is faced with a mere corpse. I have the confidence that I can face any kind of corpse calmly, as to what the corpse actually experienced at the time of death, there are related text descriptions in the textbook, but those descriptions look cold and emotionless, I still have the confidence that I can be strong enough to face such description scenarios.
